result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane M Bellinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Designer Drugs(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with all other sentences including what he is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs.  (Court does not order the DNA surcharge due to indigency).
  
Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Comply with all mental health treatment.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Sign all necessary releases to ensure compliance. 
All prescriptions must be from one pharmacy. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Submit DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with all other sentences including what he is currently serving.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shane M Bellinger in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF383, 14CF384
9:22 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
Atty Zell makes statement re: correction to the PSI. 

Atty Zell makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT: 
14CF383 Count 2 - 
72 months prison. 
28 months initial confinement followed by 44 months extended supervision. 
223 days credit. 
Concurrent to all other sentences including currently serving: 
Comply with all mental health treatment. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Sign all necessary release to ensure compliance. 
All prescriptions must be from one pharmacy. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Pay costs.  (Court does not order the DNA surcharge due to indigency)
Submit DNA sample. 

14CF384 -
4 years prison.
2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision.
223 days credit.
Concurrent with all other sentences.
Same conditions as 14CF383.
Pay costs. 

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Shane M Bellinger in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Shane M Bellinger in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-383 and 14CF-384.

1:18 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matters are scheduled for a plea today.
There is a plea agreement.

14CF-383: Defendant will plead to Count 2.  Counts 1, 3 and 4 would be dismissed and read in
State will recommend prison.
Defense will be free to argue.
State will be requesting a PSI.

14CF-384: Defendant will plead to this count.
State will recommend prison.
Defense is free to argue.
Parties will be requesting a PSI.

Atty McFarland concurs with the agreement.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF-383: Count 2: GUILTY
14CF-384: GUILTY

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court informs Defendant as to voting rights and firearm rights.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-383: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-383: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
14CF-383: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-383: Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-384: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be completed by November 7th and copies to be forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2017 at 09:15 am.
